Description: Heavy bronze axe-head: with a convex cutting-edge, long lugs and flanged edges. The piece is quite thickly corroded in parts and all its edges are worn and frayed. There are numerous scratches and shallow tool-marks. The cutting edge is severely blunted through heavy use.
Curator's comments: Metallographic analysis has indicated that after casting the blade was quite heavily worked and then annealed, with a final cold working. Bibliography: Nash, ‘Proceedings of the Society of Biblical Archaeology’ 34 (London, 1912), 36, pl. I, 64.
Bibliographic references: Davies 1987 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities in the British Museum (134)
Previous owner: Previous owner/ex-collection: Sir Henry Solomon Wellcome
